name: Urea
usageGuidelines: Apply as a nitrogen source during the vegetative growth stage.
soilImpact: Enhances nitrogen content but may lead to leaching if overused.

name: Di-Ammonium Phosphate (DAP)
usageGuidelines: Apply during sowing to supply phosphorus and nitrogen.
soilImpact: Improves root development; excessive use can cause phosphorus buildup.

name: Potash (Muriate of Potash - MOP)
usageGuidelines: Apply during soil preparation to enhance potassium levels.
soilImpact: Improves drought resistance; overuse may affect soil structure.

name: Glyphosate
usageGuidelines: Use as a non-selective herbicide for weed control before planting.
soilImpact: Minimal residual activity; overuse can affect microbial balance.

name: Chlorpyrifos
usageGuidelines: Apply to control a wide range of insect pests.
soilImpact: Persistent in soil; toxic to non-target organisms.

name: Monocrotophos
usageGuidelines: Use for controlling sucking and chewing insects.
soilImpact: Highly toxic; poses risks to humans and wildlife.

name: Imidacloprid
usageGuidelines: Apply to manage sucking pests like aphids and whiteflies.
soilImpact: Low persistence; potential impact on pollinators.

name: Mancozeb
usageGuidelines: Use as a protective fungicide against fungal diseases.

name: Carbendazim
usageGuidelines: Apply to control a broad spectrum of fungal diseases.
soilImpact: Can persist in soil; overuse may lead to resistance.

name: 2,4-D
usageGuidelines: Use as a selective herbicide for broadleaf weed control.
soilImpact: Low persistence; potential for drift to non-target plants.
